title: Eurostar receives passenger number boost
text:
0 comments Tom Newcombe Tue, 25 Aug 2015 11:24 Follow @thomasnewcombe Eurostar has reported it transported more than one million passengers in July, the highest number carried in one month.
The cross-channel operator saw a year-on-year increase in traffic of 5.1 per cent compared with the same period in 2014.
Eurostar said passenger numbers were boosted by the introduction of a new direct service from London to the south of France, which was launched earlier this year.
Eurostar CEO Nicolas Petrovic, said: “We have seen unprecedented demand over the summer months as customers are taking advantage of our frequent services and new routes.
“With passenger numbers increasing year-on-year, we are looking forward to the arrival of our new trains. The combination of more seats, superior comfort and state-of-the art design is set to transform the travel experience.”
In March, the government sold its 40 per cent stake in Eurostar, raising around £760 million.
